doc.field: Files of reference material, circa 2004-12, some used for an article in WNYF on communications/cell towers, most perhaps used as research & reference for Spadafora's Fire Science course (FIS 101) at John Jay/CUNY. 2007 course syllabus (text is Introduction to Fire Protection by Robert Klinoff and the course is structured around the chapters, which include administrative matters, building codes, and technical matters (equipment, fire protection, prevention, chemistry/physics); many Spadafora files refer to chapters and likely tie to these). Files hold tearsheets, presentations, product materials, webpages, FDNY policies & procedures, etc. Primary topics are communications (cell towers, radios, wi-fi, interoperability, FD Operations Command-FDOC, etc.), Compressed Air Foam Systems (CAFS), and explosion protection (dust, sugar dust). Some material relates to WTC in connection with the technical topics. Lots of CDs with product info and other matter. (Includes digital formats)
